'''Prevalence :'''

- overall (community-acquired HAIs and HAIs on equipment): 70 / 100,000 inhabitants / year in France

- children (community-acquired HAI): 22/100,000 / year (80/100,000 in children under 1 year of age)

'''Terrain and contributing factors:''''

- age

- male sex

- diabetes

- obesity

- active smoking

- underlying joint pathology: osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, etc. ...

In children, HAI usually occurs in the absence of risk factors.

Overall mortality: 5%.

'''Morbidity:''' 40% functional sequelae

question.title: What is the typical age group where HAIs in children usually occur?
question.description: In children, HAIs usually occur in the absence of risk factors. What age group do they usually occur in?

option_a.title: Children under 1 year of age
option_a.description: The age group where HAIs in children usually occur in the presence of risk factors.

option_b.title: Children between 1 and 10 years old
option_b.description: The age group where HAIs in children are more common due to increased exposure to pathogens.

option_c.title: Children between 11 and 18 years old
option_c.description: The age group where HAIs in children are more likely to be caused by antibiotic-resistant bacteria.

option_d.title: Children under 1 year of age
option_d.description: The age group where HAIs in children usually occur, even in the absence of risk factors.
